definition: a piece of public land in or near a city that is kept free of houses and other buildings and can be used for pleasure and exercise
example_sentence: We went for a walk in the park.

definition: a physical or mental activity or contest that has rules and that people do for pleasure
example_sentence: Baseball is my favorite game.

definition: to hit (someone or something) with your foot
example_sentence: The attacker kicked him in the stomach.

definition: an animal with a thick woolly coat that is often raised for meat or for its wool and skin
example_sentence: There was one sheep in the field.

definition: to decide that a particular person or thing is the one that you want
example_sentence: Which shirt would you choose?

definition: to take and hold (something) with your fingers, hands, etc.
example_sentence: I grasped the end of the rope and pulled as hard as I could.

definition: rising or extending upward a great distance
example_sentence: The apartment has high ceilings.

definition: to move or go up (something) using your feet and often your hands
example_sentence: It took them six days to climb the mountain.

definition: a situation or occurrence that is an instance or example of something
example_sentence: That was true in all three cases.

definition: the time of darkness between one day and the next
example_sentence: Who are you calling at this time of night?

definition: containing a lot of sugar
example_sentence: I had a craving for something sweet.

definition: a part of an animal's body that is used for flying or gliding
example_sentence: The swan flapped its wings noisily.

definition: used to indicate what someone said or thought about what was going to happen or be done
example_sentence: She said (that) she would help me with my project.

definition: the supply of goods available for sale in a store
example_sentence: That camera is out of stock.

definition: to make a picture or design using paints
example_sentence: He painted that portrait of his wife.

definition: a small object produced by a plant from which a new plant can grow
example_sentence: He planted the seeds three inches apart.

definition: the cover or top of a building, vehicle, etc.
example_sentence: The roof is leaking.

definition: one time only
example_sentence: I will repeat the question once.

definition: a substance that is used as a medicine
example_sentence: The doctor put me on a course of pain-killing drugs.

definition: to become different
example_sentence: Her mood changes every hour.

definition: the form of energy that makes it possible to see things
example_sentence: The light was bright.

definition: to make (a picture, image, etc.) by making lines on a surface especially with a pencil, pen, marker, chalk, etc., but not usually with paint
example_sentence: You draw very well.

definition: a very small amount of liquid that falls in a rounded shape
example_sentence: He squeezed the bottle until a few drops came out.

definition: to pull (something) behind you especially on the ground
example_sentence: The dog was trailing its leash.

definition: having little money or few possessions
example_sentence: We were too poor to buy new clothes.

definition: a person who is trained to care for sick or injured people and who usually works in a hospital or doctor's office
example_sentence: The nurse will take your blood pressure before the doctor sees you.

definition: to walk a long distance especially for pleasure or exercise
example_sentence: We spent the afternoon hiking around the lake.

definition: the condition of being well or free from disease
example_sentence: We nursed him back to health.

definition: to come to or reach a place after traveling, being sent, etc.
example_sentence: He arrived home at six o'clock.

definition: an amount of money that you have to pay to the government so that it can pay for public services
example_sentence: The decision was made to raise taxes.

definition: a building that is used for Christian religious services
example_sentence: This is the oldest church in town.

definition: someone who prepares and cooks food for eating at home, in a restaurant, etc.
example_sentence: He's a good cook.

definition: a unit of money that is equal to ¹/₁₀₀ of the basic unit of money in many countries
example_sentence: A dime is worth 10 cents.

definition: a piece of paper, wood, etc., with words or pictures on it that gives information about something
example_sentence: The sign in the store window says “OPEN.”

definition: one of the 24 equal parts of a day
example_sentence: She wasn't supposed to eat for six hours before the operation.

definition: used to say that something is possible
example_sentence: It might be true.

definition: a round container that has tall, curving sides and that is used for preparing or serving foods and liquids
example_sentence: This bowl has a history of over 300 years.

definition: a covering for the hand that has separate parts for each finger
example_sentence: He stuck his gloves in his pocket.

definition: a plural of penny
example_sentence: That pen cost ten pence.

definition: a large wild animal that is similar to a dog and that often hunts in groups
example_sentence: The wolf is an endangered species.

definition: to desire or wish for (something)
example_sentence: Do you want more coffee?

definition: a woman who rules a country and who usually inherits her position and rules for life

definition: having great physical power and ability
example_sentence: He's as strong as an ox.

definition: to cause or allow (something) to be seen
example_sentence: He showed her a picture.

definition: newly produced, made, gathered, etc.
example_sentence: The meat was kept fresh in the refrigerator.

definition: a type or kind of something
example_sentence: Coal is a form of carbon.

definition: to be able to touch, pick up, or grab (something) by moving or stretching
example_sentence: She couldn't reach the apple. She was too short.

definition: physical strength, power, or effect
example_sentence: The front of the car took the full force of the collision.

definition: a usually sweet food (such as a blueberry, orange, or apple) that grows on a tree or bush
example_sentence: Eat plenty of fresh fruit and vegetables.

definition: an open area of land without trees or buildings
example_sentence: He gazed out across the fields.

definition: not moving quickly
example_sentence: She is a slow driver.

definition: to not move, walk, etc., after doing so before
example_sentence: She was walking toward me, and then she suddenly stopped.

definition: the planet on which we live
example_sentence: Earth is the third planet from the sun.

definition: to move past someone or something
example_sentence: The boat was too tall to pass under the bridge.

definition: not rising or extending upward a great distance

definition: a four-sided shape that is made up of four straight sides that are the same length and that has four right angles
example_sentence: The fabric is decorated with circles and squares.

definition: a natural movement of air outside

definition: the part of a room on which you stand

definition: a box made of wire or metal bars in which people keep animals or birds
example_sentence: There are two birds in the cage.

definition: to move through water by moving your arms and legs
example_sentence: He's teaching the children to swim.

definition: a band of material (such as leather) that is worn around a person's waist
example_sentence: I fastened the buckle on my belt.

definition: during the time that
example_sentence: Someone called while you were out.

definition: in an early stage of life, growth, or development
example_sentence: He looks young for his age.

definition: the large round object that circles the Earth and that shines at night by reflecting light from the sun

definition: the direction that is to your left when you are facing the rising sun

definition: a series of classes about a particular subject in a school
example_sentence: She's taking a chemistry course this semester.

definition: in return or reply
example_sentence: I gave the book to him and he gave it back (to me).

definition: a region of a country that is controlled by the country's central government but that has the authority to make its own laws about certain things
example_sentence: Today is a state holiday here.

definition: a division of an act in a play during which the action takes place in a single place without a break in time

definition: to come with (something or someone) to a place
example_sentence: I'll bring a bottle of wine (with me) when I come to your party.

definition: a seed that is eaten as a vegetable and that comes from any one of many different kinds of climbing plants

definition: a vehicle that has wings and an engine and can carry people or things in the air

definition: used in questions to ask who owns something, has something, etc.

definition: a statement that tells you what is or is not allowed in a particular game, situation, etc.

definition: a long narrow mark on a surface

definition: a statement saying you will be harmed if you do not do what someone wants you to do

definition: a piece of clothing for a woman or a girl that has a top part that covers the upper body and a skirt that hangs down to cover the legs

definition: a thick liquid that is eaten with or on food to add flavor to it
example_sentence: She tried several sauces before she found one she liked.

example_sentence: Throw me the car keys.

definition: not costing a lot of money

definition: a piece of clothing for the upper body that has sleeves and usually a collar and buttons down the front

definition: to form an opinion or give an answer about something when you do not know much or anything about it
example_sentence: Can you guess how many people were there?

definition: used to say “yes” or to agree to a request or suggestion
example_sentence: “Can you help me with this?” “Sure.”

definition: a style of jazz music that has a lively rhythm and that is played mostly for dancing
example_sentence: They are a swing band.

definition: a short piece of writing that is used to help someone remember something
example_sentence: She wrote a note to remind herself about the appointment.

definition: to own, use, or hold (something)
example_sentence: Do they have a new car?

definition: not cool or cold

definition: having a large distance to the bottom from the surface or highest point

definition: a piece of cloth with a special design that is used as a symbol of a nation or group
example_sentence: The flag was flying over the fort.

definition: a place where people live that is larger than a village but smaller than a city

definition: to add (people or things) together to find the total number
example_sentence: Count the plates on the table.

definition: a shout of praise or encouragement

definition: the whole system or set of rules made by the government of a town, state, country, etc.

definition: a plant that has stems of wood and is smaller than a tree

definition: used to say that something belongs or relates to a particular person or thing and to no other

definition: a long, hollow object that is used especially to control the flow of a liquid or gas

definition: a building in which a family lives

definition: to build, create, or produce (something) by work or effort

definition: smallest in amount or degree

definition: unusual or strange

definition: to use weapons or physical force to try to hurt someone, to defeat an enemy, etc.

definition: any one of the 12 parts into which the year is divided

definition: a large hole that was formed by natural processes in the side of a cliff or hill or under the ground

definition: a plant that grows very quickly where it is not wanted and covers or kills more desirable plants

definition: the cloud of black, gray, or white gases and dust that is produced by burning something

definition: a small area of a surface that is different from other areas

definition: to cut (something) into pieces by hitting it with the sharp edge of an ax, knife, etc.

definition: to chase and kill (wild animals) for food or pleasure
example_sentence: The wolf was hunting its prey.

definition: a system that uses wires and radio signals to send people's voices over long distances
example_sentence: We spoke by phone earlier.

definition: to move your hand or something held in your hand usually in a repeated motion in order to signal or greet someone

definition: the top layer of earth in which plants grow

definition: a group of vehicles that travel on a track and are connected to each other and usually to an engine

definition: to form letters or numbers on a surface with a pen, pencil, etc.

definition: a large animal that is used for riding and for carrying and pulling things

definition: the joint that bends at the middle of your leg

definition: soft, white pieces of frozen water that fall to the ground from the sky in cold weather

definition: an object that is shaped like a large ball with a map of the world on it

definition: to press together the parts and especially the opposite sides of (something)

definition: to tell (someone) about possible danger or trouble

definition: the hard outer covering of an animal, insect, etc., that protects it

definition: the direction that is to your right when you are facing the rising sun

definition: a number or letter that indicates how a student performed in a class or on a test

definition: the part of a person that thinks, reasons, feels, and remembers

definition: the ability to grow, change, etc., that separates plants and animals from things like water or rocks

definition: a piece of jewelry that is worn usually on a finger

definition: to refuse to show that you hear or see (something or someone)

definition: firm or hard

definition: an awareness by your body of something in it or on it

definition: on, during, or for this day

definition: in a circle

definition: the part of your body where your arm is connected

definition: something that helps produce or influence a result

definition: someone or something is small, unimportant, etc.

definition: not completely

definition: the way that something is built, arranged, or organized

definition: not having or including another

definition: an area of land that rises very high above the land around it and that is higher than a hill

definition: to say that (something) is similar to something else

definition: to get away from a place (such as a prison) where you are being held or kept
example_sentence: The prisoner escaped (from jail).

definition: the act or process of choosing someone for a public office by voting

definition: to say that (something) will or might happen in the future

definition: a person who is a father or mother

definition: a statement made by a person with authority that tells someone to do something
example_sentence: The captain was barking out orders to the crew.

definition: to plan or want to do (something)
example_sentence: He intended that his daughter would inherit the business.

definition: a room in which food is cooked
example_sentence: She wants a house with a large kitchen.

definition: to give someone the opportunity to accept or take (something)
example_sentence: We'd like to offer the job to you.

definition: an area or section of a country, city, or town
example_sentence: She represents the eighth congressional district.

definition: careful study that is done to find and report new knowledge about something
example_sentence: Recent research shows that the disease is caused in part by bad nutrition.

definition: an unexpected event, piece of information, etc.
example_sentence: What a pleasant surprise to see you!

definition: individual human beings, the plural of person.
example_sentence: We met all sorts of people on the trip.

definition: a long written story usually about imaginary characters and events
example_sentence: This novel is worth reading.

definition: an illness that affects a person, animal, or plant
example_sentence: He suffers from a rare genetic disease.

definition: to do (something that is illegal or harmful)
example_sentence: The massacre was committed by the rebel army.

definition: a task or job that someone is given to do
example_sentence: Our mission was to recover the stolen plans.

definition: to talk about, write about, or refer to (something or someone) especially in a brief way
example_sentence: In her speech, she mentioned (the help of) her parents, husband, and fellow actors.

definition: inside (a certain area or space)
example_sentence: They live within the city limits.

definition: the range, distance, or space that is covered or affected by something or included in something
example_sentence: She tried to determine the extent of the damage.

definition: happening or beginning not long ago
example_sentence: Recent events have brought attention to the problem.

definition: a record of money that has been paid and money that has been received
example_sentence: He kept detailed accounts.

definition: the beliefs, customs, arts, etc., of a particular society, group, place, or time
example_sentence: Her art shows the influence of popular culture.

definition: making very little noise
example_sentence: He spoke in a very quiet voice.

definition: located in or toward the south
example_sentence: The family resides in Southern France.

definition: at all times :  in a way that does not change
example_sentence: Always lock your car.

definition: something that is said or written as a reply to something
example_sentence: He got a response to his letter.

definition: to tell someone the appearance, sound, smell, events, etc., of (something or someone)
example_sentence: The witness wasn't able to describe the robber.

definition: using care
example_sentence: He is a careful driver.

definition: for the reason that
example_sentence: I ran because I was afraid.

definition: an area of ground where plants (such as flowers or vegetables) are grown
example_sentence: We planted a small garden in our backyard.

definition: to have (something) inside
example_sentence: The box contains an assortment of old papers.

definition: a thick growth of trees and bushes that covers a large area
example_sentence: Fires destroyed acres of forest.

definition: to send (something that has arrived, such as a letter) to another place
example_sentence: Please forward my mail to my new address.

definition: something (such as a gun, knife, club, or bomb) that is used for fighting or attacking someone or for defending yourself when someone is attacking you
example_sentence: The police still haven't found the murder weapon.

definition: the system of words or signs that people use to express thoughts and feelings to each other
example_sentence: Tears are the silent language of grief.

definition: the radio stations, television stations, and newspapers through which information is communicated to the public
example_sentence: The event attracted a lot of attention from the media.

definition: despite the fact that
example_sentence: Although he was hungry, he could not eat.

definition: to seem to be something
example_sentence: She appears angry.

definition: relating to or occurring in a particular area, city, or town
example_sentence: Are you making a local (telephone) call or a long-distance one?

definition: not one or the other of two people or things
example_sentence: Neither answer is correct.

definition: a school in the U.S. that you go to after high school
example_sentence: She teaches art at a local college.

definition: a person who drives a car, truck, etc.
example_sentence: Who was the driver at the time of the accident?

definition: a building or room in which people work at desks doing business or professional activities
example_sentence: She works at our Chicago office.

definition: happening, done, or made every week
example_sentence: I make weekly trips to the grocery store.

definition: one of the five long parts of the hand that are used for holding things
example_sentence: Don't stick your fingers in the cookie batter!

definition: a basic unit of money in the U.S., Canada, Australia, and other countries that is equal to 100 cents
example_sentence: The shirt costs 20 dollars.

definition: a process by which someone is taught the skills that are needed for an art, profession, or job
example_sentence: The job requires special training.

definition: an act of carefully looking at or examining the quality or condition of something or someone
example_sentence: Changes to the building had to be made after the review by the safety inspectors.

definition: to cause (something) to exist or continue without changing
example_sentence: They have always maintained high standards of professional conduct.

definition: the material that is used in the form of thin sheets for writing or printing on, wrapping things, etc.
example_sentence: We'll need pens, glue, and some paper.

definition: the way that something is done or happens
example_sentence: She has a very forceful manner of speaking.

definition: to direct the behavior of (a person or animal)
example_sentence: The parents could not control their child.

definition: to allow (something) to happen
example_sentence: The judge permitted the release of the prisoner.

definition: to give reasons for or against something
example_sentence: She argued against the proposed law.

definition: something that is caused by something else that happened or was done before
example_sentence: The book is the result of years of hard work and dedication.

definition: to make a choice about (something)
example_sentence: He decided that dinner would be at 7 o'clock, and asked guests to arrive at 6.

definition: relating to or involving activities in which people spend time talking to each other or doing enjoyable things with each other
example_sentence: She has poor social skills.

definition: to choose (someone or something) from a group
example_sentence: Please select one item from the list.

definition: not speaking or making noise
example_sentence: She was silent for a few minutes as she thought about how to answer him.

definition: in opposition to (someone or something)
example_sentence: Everyone was against them.

definition: work done by the mind or body
example_sentence: He put a lot of effort into finishing the project on time.

definition: to become larger or greater in size, amount, number, etc.
example_sentence: Sales increased this year.

definition: for the use of a single person or group
example_sentence: He returned to the country on his private jet.

definition: physical or mental effort
example_sentence: A day's labor should get the job done.

definition: something that a person or group does
example_sentence: As its first official action , the committee elected Ms. Jones as its president.

definition: to go or come into (something)
example_sentence: Knock on the door before you enter the room.

definition: a feeling of happiness, enjoyment, or satisfaction
example_sentence: I paint for the sheer pleasure of it.

definition: not having any doubt about something
example_sentence: Are you certain you want to leave today?

definition: belonging to or shared by two or more people or groups
example_sentence: They have a common ancestor.

definition: a specific height
example_sentence: The pictures were hung on the wall at eye level.

definition: something (especially something important or notable) that happens
example_sentence: The article recounted the events of the past year.

definition: a small town in the country
example_sentence: We stayed in a charming bed-and-breakfast in a lakeside village.

definition: one of four equal parts of something
example_sentence: Cut the pie into quarters.

definition: the state of the air and atmosphere at a particular time and place
example_sentence: How's the weather?

definition: occupying the number two position in a series
example_sentence: We sat in the second row.

definition: sounds that are sung by voices or played on musical instruments
example_sentence: This is one of my favorite pieces of music.

definition: someone or something that belongs to or is a part of a group or an organization
example_sentence: The club has 300 members.

definition: to get or be given (something)
example_sentence: You will be charged a late fee if the electric company does not receive your payment on time.

definition: a building where people are kept as punishment for a crime or while they are waiting to go to court
example_sentence: The state plans to build two more prisons.

definition: almost not at all
example_sentence: She could hardly bear to look at him.

definition: a person who gives opinions about books, movies, or other forms of art
example_sentence: He is an influential literary critic.

definition: a painting, drawing, or photograph of someone or something
example_sentence: I hung the picture on the wall.

definition: not at any time
example_sentence: I will never shop at that store again.

definition: the fact of getting or achieving wealth, respect, or fame
example_sentence: Success came easily to him.

definition: in or through (a group of people or things)
example_sentence: The disease spread quickly among the members of the community.

definition: in the space that separates (two things or people)
example_sentence: The ball rolled between the desk and the wall.

definition: a person who runs a farm
example_sentence: My uncle has been a farmer for 60 years.

definition: a series of actions that produce something or that lead to a particular result
example_sentence: How does the election process work?

definition: a period of time that is used to do a particular activity
example_sentence: Her health insurance will cover 12 one-hour sessions of therapy per year.

definition: to stop (something) from happening or existing
example_sentence: Seatbelts in cars often prevent serious injuries.

definition: a picture that is produced by a camera, artist, mirror, etc.
example_sentence: She studied her image in the mirror.

definition: a coin or a unit of money equal to ¹/₁₀₀ of a dollar
example_sentence: We got the car for just pennies.

definition: the physical world and everything in it (such as plants, animals, mountains, oceans, stars, etc.) that is not made by people
example_sentence: The most amazing thing about nature is its infinite variety.

definition: older in age
example_sentence: She is five years senior to me.

definition: to buy (property, goods, etc.)
example_sentence: He purchased a new suit for a hundred dollars.

definition: attractive to look at usually in a simple or delicate way
example_sentence: She has a pretty face.

definition: made of gold
example_sentence: She wore golden earrings.

definition: having the power, skill, money, etc., that is needed to do something
example_sentence: He will buy a new car as soon as he is able.

definition: a usually rented room or set of rooms that is part of a building and is used as a place to live
example_sentence: We lived in an apartment for several years before buying a house.

definition: a large, round object in space (such as the Earth) that travels around a star (such as the sun)
example_sentence: We must help preserve the planet.

definition: to make or produce (something)
example_sentence: Several new government programs were created while she was governor.

definition: the weight or force that is produced when something presses or pushes against something else
example_sentence: Keep steady pressure on the cap as you turn it.

definition: something that is made or grown to be sold or used
example_sentence: The company's newest product is selling well.

definition: two people who are married or who have a romantic or sexual relationship
example_sentence: Seventeen couples participated in the survey.

definition: to talk or write about (something that you are thinking or feeling)
example_sentence: He expressed an interest in meeting her.

definition: the number 20
example_sentence: I have told you twenty times.

definition: the smaller group of the two groups of people who meet to discuss and make the laws of a country, state, etc.
example_sentence: The Senate is expected to pass the bill shortly.

definition: easy or possible to get or use
example_sentence: The family kept emergency supplies available.

definition: something that a country has and can use to increase its wealth
example_sentence: Oil is essentially their only resource.

definition: unable to be done or to happen
example_sentence: It's impossible to predict the future.

definition: actively doing something
example_sentence: She's busy preparing for her test.

definition: a word or symbol (such as “five” or “16”) that represents a specific amount or quantity
example_sentence: I think you have the wrong number.

definition: the period of time that will come after the present time
example_sentence: He promises to do better in future.

definition: the opportunity or ability to choose something or to choose between two or more things
example_sentence: You have the option of staying home or coming with us.

definition: to receive or take (something offered)
example_sentence: They offered him the job, and he accepted it.

definition: very large
example_sentence: The team's mascot is a giant swan.

definition: a soft, juicy red fruit that grows on a low plant with white flowers
example_sentence: We picked strawberries.

definition: in a good state or condition that is not easily changed or likely to change
example_sentence: They have a stable relationship.

definition: a drawing or picture that shows only the shape of an object
example_sentence: An outline of his face showed his high forehead, long nose, and small chin.

definition: a teacher who works with one student
example_sentence: I got a tutor to help me with my homework.

definition: in or to a foreign country that is across a sea or ocean
example_sentence: I lived overseas for a time.

definition: a young dog
example_sentence: Our dog just had four puppies.

definition: having a lot of snow
example_sentence: The weather has been very snowy recently.

definition: a large building usually with high, thick walls and towers that was built in the past to protect against attack
example_sentence: Millionaires built their castles along the lake.

definition: thin strips of salted and smoked meat from the sides and the back of a pig
example_sentence: We ate bacon and eggs for breakfast.

definition: food sold by a grocer
example_sentence: She stopped to pick up some groceries for supper.

definition: a usually curved piece of metal, plastic, or wood that is used for hanging clothing
example_sentence: I hung my coat up on a hanger.

definition: a track with rails on which trains run
example_sentence: The railway is still under construction.

definition: having a lot of wind
example_sentence: It's a windy day.

definition: a question or problem that requires thought, skill, or cleverness to be answered or solved
example_sentence: Can you figure out this puzzle?

definition: to take and use (something that belongs to someone else) for a period of time before returning it
example_sentence: Can I borrow your camera?

definition: an underground railway system in some cities
example_sentence: Can you reach the park by metro?

definition: the action or sound of laughing
example_sentence: Laughter filled the air.

definition: to become shorter
example_sentence: The days have begun to shorten.

definition: to make (land, water, air, etc.) dirty and not safe or suitable to use
example_sentence: Waste from the factory had polluted the river.

definition: a sweet baked food that is usually small, flat, and round and is made from flour and sugar
example_sentence: This recipe makes about two dozen cookies.

definition: a person who does medical work
example_sentence: A medic at the border post told me about a family who'd recently arrived.

definition: a yellow citrus fruit that has a sour taste
example_sentence: The recipe calls for the juice of two lemons.

definition: a business that gives customers beauty treatments (such as haircuts)
example_sentence: There is a new hair salon on the second floor.

definition: to make (something) thick or thicker or to become thick or thicker
example_sentence: I thickened the gravy with flour.

definition: a television or radio station
example_sentence: The TV program airs at 8:00 p.m. on Channel 5.

definition: an imaginary animal that can breathe out fire and looks like a very large lizard with wings, a long tail, and large claws
example_sentence: Dragons are legendary animals.

definition: a plant that has large leaves that are eaten especially in salads
example_sentence: Clean the lettuce leaves one by one.

definition: a game that is played by two people or two pairs of people on a special court (called a tennis court) where they hit a small ball back and forth over a net using rackets
example_sentence: He is a great tennis player.

definition: a large vehicle that has two large back wheels and two smaller front wheels and that is used to pull farm equipment
example_sentence: Our tractor is out of order.
